pageContext.claim: “This is leaking really big stuff [referring to James Comey]. I remember the young sailor [Kristian Saucier]. In fact, I helped him out with his family because I thought he was so unfairly treated, as you know. I remember he had confidential information, which is a much, much lower standard than classified. And they put him in jail for a long time. They took away his life.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump uses the unfounded accusation that former FBI director James Comey leaked classified information to point out what he argues is a double-standard, because Kristian Saucier, who was in the Navy, was jailed "for a long time ... they took away his life" for taking pictures of a classified area in a submarine and illegally retaining them. Not only is the accusation against Comey unfounded, Trump exaggerates Saucier's penalty. He pleaded guilty, was sentenced to one year in prison, and was released in September 2017, before Trump pardoned him the following March.
